alert.note: Alert for City of Norfolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 3:46PM EDT until August 28 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent cities, City of Norfolk and City of Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 343 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the City of Virginia Beach. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Most of the heavy rain has ended. Therefore, this Flood Warning replaces the Flash Flood Warning that was in effect for eastern portions of Norfolk and far northwest portions of Virginia Beach. Remember, additional Flash Flood Warnings remain in effect for central and western portions of Norfolk as well as the northeast portion of Virginia Beach. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Virginia Wesleyan University, Kempsville, Regent University, Ocean View, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Norfolk International and Gallups Corner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
